intro: Kneiffia arenicola, commonly known as the Mediterranean sandwort, is a low-growing, succulent plant native to the Mediterranean region. It thrives in sandy and rocky soils, often found in coastal areas and arid environments. The plant has small, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in dry conditions. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, appearing in clusters during the spring and summer months. Kneiffia arenicola is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
